abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column notes Bank of America will hold significant vote in September, asking shareholders to permit board of directors free reign in setting structure; points out some shareholders are upset by overturning of bylaw by board, which then elected chief executive Brian T Moynihan; says vote will grant shareholders due respect.
lead_paragraph: A decision on separating top roles at the bank is less about who is chairman and more about how shareholders’ decisions are valued.

headline.main: At Bank of America, a Vote to Give Shareholders Due Respect
headline.print_headline: A Vote to Give Shareholders Due Respect
